summary: BMO Capital's five-star analyst Brian Pitz reaffirmed a "Buy" rating on the stock . Pitz said the updates could improve viewer retention, increase content discovery and drive revenue . Momentum investing is all about the idea of following a stock's recent trend, which can be in either direction . In the 'long' context, investors will essentially be "buying high, but hoping to sell even higher" The Zacks Momentum Style Score is part of the Zacks Style Scores .  Netflix currently has a Zacks Rank of #2 (Buy) and Style Scores of A or B outperform the market over the following one-month period . For NFLX, shares are up 4.99% over the past week .  Shares of Netflix have increased 9.65% over the past quarter, and have gained 86.97% in the last year . NFLX's monthly price change of 24.24% compares favorably with the industry's 3.11% performance . Broadcast Radio and Television industry is up 0.3% over same time period .  Over the past two months, 11 earnings estimates moved higher compared to none lower for the full year . These revisions helped boost NFLX's consensus estimate, increasing from $24.58 to $25.33 in the past 60 days . NFLX is a #2 (Buy) stock with a Momentum Score of B . Netflix currently has an average brokerage recommendation (ABR) of 1.61, on a scale of 1 to 5 (Strong Buy to Strong Sell), calculated based on the actual recommendations (Buy, Hold, Sell, etc.) made by 45 brokerage firms . Of the 45 recommendations that derive the current ABR, 30 are Strong Buy and two are Buy .  According to several studies, brokerage recommendations have little to no success guiding investors to choose stocks with the most potential for price appreciation . As a result of the vested interest of brokerage firms in a stock they cover, their analysts tend to rate it with a strong positive bias .  The ABR is calculated solely based on brokerage recommendations . The Zacks Rank is a quantitative model allowing investors to harness the power of earnings estimate revisions . It is displayed in whole numbers -- 1 to 5 .  Near-term stock price movements are strongly correlated with trends in earnings estimate revisions, according to empirical research . Zacks Rank grades are applied proportionately to all stocks for which analysts provide current-year earnings estimates . In contrast, ABR is driven by earnings estimates, which are constantly revised .  The recent change in the consensus estimate, along with three other factors related to earnings estimates, has resulted in a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) for Netflix . optimism over the company's earnings prospects, as indicated by strong agreement among them in revising EPS estimates higher, could be a legitimate reason for the stock to soar in the near term .

The four companies below look like excellent options to consider now . Eli Lilly, Vertex, Meta Platforms, and Netflix all stand to enjoy solid growth . Investors should see excellent returns over long periods of, say, a decade or more .  Eli Lilly is an excellent stock for growth and income-oriented investors . Its famous brands like Mounjaro and Zepbound are growing their sales at an almost dizzying pace . Lilly recently reported positive phase 3 results for an oral GLP-1 therapy, orforglipron .  Vertex Pharmaceuticals has what might be the most powerful moat in the world . It holds a monopoly in the market for drugs that treat a rare lung disease called cystic fibrosis . This dominance grants the biotech significant pricing power .  Meta Platforms recently delivered excellent first-quarter financial results . The company has an ecosystem of 3.43 billion daily active users across its websites and apps . Artificial intelligence initiatives are helping drive user growth . Vertex should see plenty of clinical progress over the next five years .  Management announced significant AI investments, and given the results they've helped achieve, Meta seems justified in going that route . AI and advertising will be considerable long-term growth avenues for the company, especially considering that Meta Platforms won't lose its lead in the social media sphere .  "Netflix" is often used as a synonym for streaming, and none of its competitors has this kind of edge . Netflix estimates a $650 billion revenue opportunity, of which it has just scratched the surface . Netflix is launching a major overhaul to its home page that could help user engagement . The platform homepage on mobile will provide a TikTok-style vertical feed of clips and trailers from movies and shows .  Users will see popular titles and award-winning features more prominent on the platform home for TVs . Shortcuts to different categories will be moved from the left side of the screen to the top . Netflix is also usingOpenAIto help with search recommendations for users in an effort to be more responsive to your moods and interest in the moment .  The changes to the home page across mobile and TV will be a good test to see if user engagement increases . Netflix already features its top-watched TV shows and movies in users’ feeds, but the top hits could see a more prominent placement . The streaming giant will also be able to show viral clips from shows and films via the TikTok-style feed .  As Netflix builds out its live content, the streamer can also find new ways to highlight live content at the top of a feed and highlight events as they are currently happening .

The update is rolling out globally over the next few months . It's meant to help users find something to watch faster and more intuitively . There's no revenue figure tied to the update .  A TikTok-style vertical video feed is also being tested on mobile . This is a sign Netflix is experimenting with how people discover content . The company is also using more personalized data signals .
